title: Vadodara car crash: 'Rakshit Chaurasiya may have insisted on driving'
content: CCTV footage from the investigation into a fatal accident revealed that Pranshu Chauhan initially took the driver's seat but then moved to the front passenger seat at the insistence of Rakshit Chaurasiya. Chaurasiya then drove the car and later crashed into three two-wheelers, killing one woman and injuring seven others.

title: Rajnath asks Netherlands not to supply weapons to terror-sponsor Pakistan
content: India has asked the Netherlands to halt supplying arms and military technology to Pakistan due to its history of sponsoring terrorism. In a meeting between defence ministers, both countries agreed to strengthen ties in defence, security, maritime cooperation, and emerging technologies. Collaboration in shipbuilding and space sectors was also discussed, alongside integrating Indian vendors into Dutch supply chains.

title: D-St investors wealthier by Rs 8.67 L cr in 2 days; know why market's rising
content: BSE Sensex and Nifty50 indices saw significant rallies, with Sensex rising by 1,131 points and Nifty50 by 326 points on Tuesday. Key factors driving the rally were global market cues, China's economic stimulus, and positive technical indicators.

title: 'You need family, but ...': Kapil Dev on BCCI's family travel curbs during tours
content: Kapil Dev emphasises a balanced approach for cricketers’ families during extended tours, aligning with BCCI's new policy. Families can join players for limited days depending on tour length. Virat Kohli also highlights the importance of family support for player rejuvenation. Kapil expressed this at an event featuring top golfers in New Delhi.

title: Elon Musk names Jeff Bezos & Google, Oracle founders as smartest people he knows
content: Elon Musk praised several tech leaders including Larry Ellison, Larry Page, and Jeff Bezos for their intelligence and achievements. Despite Musk and Bezos' past rivalry, their relationship appears to be improving, notably highlighted by Musk's recent memes suggesting reconciliation.

title: IPL: Lucknow Super Giants Team Preview - SWOT Analysis and Best XI
content: Lucknow Super Giants revamped their squad for IPL 2025, parting with KL Rahul and appointing Rishabh Pant as captain. They bolstered their lineup with stars like David Miller, Aiden Markram and Mitchell Marsh. Their powerful batting unit looks strong, but their pace attack's fitness remains a concern. LSG aim to bounce back and contend for the title.

title: UP court gives death penalty to 3 men for killing 24 Dalits in 1981
content: A Uttar Pradesh court has sentenced three men to death for the 1981 massacre of 24 Dalits in Dehuli. The massacre was allegedly to punish Dalit witnesses against upper-caste criminals. Of the 17 accused, 14 died during the trial, while another is absconding. The remaining three, all in their early 70s, were convicted on Tuesday.

title: How PM Modi's 'Mann Ki Baat' changed this German girl's life forever
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mention of German singer Cassandra Mae Spittmann in Mann Ki Baat changed her life. He praised her dedication to Indian culture. She expressed profound gratitude and admiration for Modi. Her renditions in multiple Indian languages received high praise. This recognition was life-changing for her.

title: Dhruv Rathee's question to Grok on Nagpur riots divides the internet
content: Violence broke out in Nagpur’s Mahal area due to miscommunication, resulting in stone pelting and vehicles being set ablaze. Police have restored order using tear gas and deploying additional forces.

title: Don't think Kohli necessarily turned down RCB's captaincy: De Villiers
content: Former RCB batter AB de Villiers shared that Virat Kohli supported the decision to appoint Rajat Patidar as the new RCB captain. Kohli's mature reaction and endorsement of the decision highlight his commitment to the team's future. RCB's leadership, including head coach Andy Flower, praised Kohli's respect and support for Patidar as crucial for the team's success.

title: JFK Files: Will we finally learn truth about Marilyn Monroe or Cuba?
content: To understand the importance of the JFK files, we need to go back to the man himself. John F. Kennedy was more than just a president—he was a symbol, a paradox, and in many ways, a myth. He was a war hero, yet his family’s wealth and influence had insulated him from the struggles of ordinary Americans. He was a devout Catholic, yet his personal life was a whirlwind of extramarital affairs, including a rumored relationship with Marilyn Monroe. He was a Cold War warrior, taking America to the brink of nuclear war during the Cuban Missile Crisis, yet he spoke of peace and sought diplomacy with the Soviet Union. For many Americans, Kennedy was the embodiment of youthful optimism, of a nation on the cusp of greatness. But behind the glamour of Camelot, there were shadows—secrets within his administration, tensions with intelligence agencies, and enemies both at home and abroad.

title: Elon Musk's ex & mother of his three children on hardest part of parenting
content: Grimes, Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend and mother of his three children, frequently shares parenting struggles on Twitter. She recently spoke about the challenges of putting kids to bed. Additionally, Grimes has denied writing about the "sexuality and kinks" of Fortune 500 CEOs.

title: Google-parent Alphabet buys Israeli startup Wiz for $32 billion in CASH
content: Alphabet plans to acquire cybersecurity startup Wiz for $32 billion, enhancing its cloud offerings. The acquisition, awaiting regulatory approval, marks Alphabet's largest to date and aims to bolster its competitiveness against AWS and Microsoft Azure while improving cybersecurity capabilities using AI-driven solutions.

title: Parents of missing Indian-origin student ask officials to declare daughter dead
content: Sudiksha Konanki's parents wrote they have full trust in the investigation process and they believe Joshua Riibe, the 24-year-old with whom Konanki was last seen, has been cooperating with the investigators. They told the administration that once Sudiksha is legally declared dead, the family can initiate the process of grieving and honoring her memory.

title: India ranked 24th out of 33 countries in free speech index
content: Although observations and rankings showed free speech in India has worsened since 2021, Indians believe it has improved

title: Heritage meets harvest at Omalloor trade fair
content: Omalloor Vayal Vanibhavam, one of Kerala’s oldest agrarian fairs, is held from the first day of the Malayalam month of Meenam to its last. Visitors to the fair can take home a variety of farm produce, including elephant yam, colocasia, and several varieties of tubers

title: Akkulam lake rejuvenation project hits another roadblock
content: Decision pending on re-tendering the project. Concerns had been raised on the experience of the firms roped in for the project as well as the nature of the joint venture

title: Braille editions of Malayalam classics released
content: The initiative, carried out in collaboration with the Kerala Federation of the Blind, features nine novels and a poetry collection

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: The BJP government is systematically undermining MGNREGA: Sonia Gandhi
content: Speaking during the Zero Hour in the Rajya Sabha, the Congress Parliamentary Party chairperson said MGNREGA’s budget as a percentage of GDP is at a 10-year low

title: India asks U.S. to list Sikh group as terrorist organisation, Indian source says
content: India requests U.S. to list Sikhs for Justice as a terrorist group, amid growing tensions and security concerns

title: Hoax bomb threat at Pathanamthitta collectorate
content: Extensive anti-sabotage checks were carried out using the bomb detection and disposal squad on the premises of the collectorate

title: Arson, stone-pelting, attack on cops: How Nagpur endured a night full of chaos
content: Violent clashes erupted in central Nagpur near the RSS headquarters after protests over the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb escalated. Police and firemen were injured, vehicles torched, and widespread property damage ensued. Union home ministry demanded a report, while Chief Minister and local officials appealed for calm and assured strict action against rioters.

title: Team of 6 Supreme Court judges to visit Manipur relief camps on March 22
content: A team of six Supreme Court judges, headed by Justice BR Gavai, will visit violence-affected relief camps in Manipur on March 22. The delegation aims to assess the situation and improve legal and humanitarian support for those affected. The Supreme Court has been monitoring the crisis and the visit underscores efforts to address on-ground concerns.

title: Nagpur violence: 'Chhaava' film reignited people's emotions,' says Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis attributed recent violence in Nagpur to heightened emotions from the Chhaava movie, which depicts Maratha history. Violence erupted after protests against Aurangzeb's tomb, leading to curfew and multiple injuries. Authorities are investigating the premeditated attacks and ensure the responsible parties face consequences. Deputy CM Eknath Shinde also highlighted concerns about targeted conspiracies.

title: Trump deploys Indian-origin lawyer to defend deportation
content: The Trump administration, led by Indian-origin lawyer Abhishek Kambli, is defying a federal judge's orders to halt deportation flights of illegal immigrants. MAGA activists criticize the judge, claiming bias due to his daughter's work. Kambli argues the orders were issued after the flights had departed, and refuses to disclose details citing national security.

title: NPCI is making a big change to UPI feature widely misused in scams
content: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is phasing out the 'Collect Payments' feature from the UPI platform to curb fraud. This method will now be limited to verified merchants, with person-to-person requests capped at Rs 2,000, while promoting QR code-based payments.

title: Virat Kohli gets roaring welcome, surprises fans with special gift – WATCH
content: RCB launched their IPL 2025 campaign with an RCB Unbox Event, featuring Virat Kohli and new skipper Rajat Patidar. The event included the unveiling of the new team jersey, performances, and fan interactions. RCB aims to start strong against Kolkata Knight Riders on March 22.  The event featured the grand unveiling of the team’s new jersey, along with live performances and engaging interactions with players, including Virat and the newly appointed skipper, Rajat Patidar.

title: “...so very very silly,” says engineer after Meta fired him for sharing Zuckerberg's post
content: Riley Berton, a former Meta engineer, claims he was fired for sharing already-public information with his wife, questioning the company's privacy policies. He alleges 'hundreds' of colleagues faced similar terminations amid Meta's crackdown on leaks, raising concerns about workplace privacy and personal communication boundaries.

title: Watch: Raid on call centre in Pak takes bizarre turn as locals loot laptops
content: Chaos erupted in Islamabad's Sector F-11 after a raid by Pakistan's Federal Investigation Agency on a fake call center run by Chinese nationals led to looting. Despite the detention of over two dozen individuals, locals looted the premises, seizing valuables such as electronic equipment.

title: 'Sleep at 10, improve diet': Shashank on how to revive Prithvi Shaw's career
content: Once a promising talent, Prithvi Shaw's career has hit a rough patch, with setbacks like not being sold in the IPL 2025 auction and being left out of Mumbai's squads. Punjab Kings' Shashank Singh believes Shaw's potential is intact and suggests lifestyle changes, like better sleep and diet, could revive his career, emphasising discipline as key.

title: Ready to deliberate upon uploading booth-wise votes: Poll body to SC
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) expressed willingness to consider the demand for publishing booth-wise voter turnout data online during a Supreme Court hearing. The petitioners, TMC MP Mahua Moitra and Association for Democratic Reforms, have 10 days to make representations before the ECI. The ECI aims to address discrepancies in voter turnout data, ensuring transparency.

title: BJP wants to make Maharashtra next Manipur, says Aaditya Thackeray
content: Shiv Sena UBT leader Aaditya Thackeray criticized the Devendra Fadnavis-led BJP government for its handling of the Nagpur violence, suggesting it aimed to destabilize Maharashtra similar to Manipur. Thackeray highlighted the lack of response from the Chief Minister’s Office. Fadnavis addressed the legislative assembly, asserting the violence appeared well-planned and emphasized strict action against those responsible.

title: How Indian-origin NASA astronaut Sunita Williams united America and Russia
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are finally returning to Earth after nine months on the ISS due to propulsion issues with their Boeing Starliner. NASA's Crew-10 astronauts have replaced Crew-9, with members including Anne McClain, Nichole Ayers, Takuya Onishi, and Kirill Peskov, representing multiple nationalities.

title: LeBron James' son Bronny James’ Garbage Time Bucket
content: Bronny James scored a 3-pointer for the LA Lakers during garbage time in a win against the San Antonio Spurs. This moment delighted former NBA player Gilbert Arenas, who has been a vocal supporter of Bronny and believes in his potential as a valuable player.

title: IPL 2025: LSG stare at pace crisis with multiple injuries
content: Lucknow Super Giants are facing concerns over the fitness of their key fast bowlers ahead of the 2025 IPL season opener. With Mohsin Khan, Mayank Yadav, and Akash Deep dealing with injuries, the team considers turning to backup options Shardul Thakur and Shivam Mavi. Will the management take the big risk of persisting with undercooked and injury prone seamers or hand contracts to Thakur and Mavi? The big call is expected very soon!

title: Hamas claims head of its government in Gaza killed in Israeli strikes
content: Hamas claimed its Gaza government head Essam al-Dalis was killed in Israeli strikes that also killed over 300 people. Israel cited Hamas's refusal to release hostages as the reason for the attacks. The recent failed truce talks led to renewed violence, with deep-rooted mutual distrust and unresolved strategic differences between Israel and Hamas exacerbating the conflict.

title: What Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore can’t wait to do after landing on Earth
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore will return to Earth soon. They stayed on the ISS for nine months due to issues with the Boeing Starliner spacecraft. Now they will return in SpaceX's Dragon capsule. NASA planned their return for March 19, 2025. This mission highlighted both the resilience of astronauts and challenges in commercial spaceflight.

title: "He keeps getting better": Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s old photo resurfaces
content: Taylor Swift and NFL player Travis Kelce are seen on dates but try to avoid cameras. They maintain privacy after a Super Bowl incident where Travis's team lost and Taylor was booed. Fans are excited to see them again. There are speculations about Travis's NFL future and Taylor's new album, but no official word yet.

title: 'No such data maintained centrally,' Govt on Kumbh stampede toll in Lok Sabha
content: Minister Nityanand Rai informed Parliament that there is no central data on casualties during the Maha Kumbh Mela stampede in Prayagraj, as religious congregation management is a state matter. He emphasized that crowd control and disaster response fall under state jurisdiction, and states are responsible for inquiries and assistance related to such incidents.

title: Construction of new bus stand in Nagapattinam gains momentum
content: The new bus stand, being constructed at a cost of ₹30.40 crore, will have 30 bus bays, 80 shops, eight kiosks, a control room, and two pay-and-use restrooms

title: Tiruchi Corporation to conduct a drive to delete the names of the dead from the street vendor voters’ list
content: To facilitate street vendors to check their names, the voters’ list has been put up in the offices of the corporation ward committees; the special drive will be held from March 19 to 26

title: Won’t tolerate glorification of Aurangzeb: VHP on Nagpur violence
content: VHP demands action against Nagpur violence, opposes glorification of Aurangzeb, calls for removal of tomb

title: Steps being taken for Hosur airport: T.N. Minister
content: The Industries Minister said five locations were initially identified and were sent to the Centre that short-listed two of them.

title: Tiruchi GH authorities plan to install additional solar power plants
content: To be installed at a cost of ₹2 crore, the plants are expected to be commissioned by May 2026 and when fully functional may help the hospital save up to ₹32 lakh a month

title: Leader of Opposition R. Ashok alleges failure of law and order in Karnataka
content: He said that Karnataka has transformed into ‘goonda raj’ following an increase in the number of crimes during the Congress rule

title: 1981 Dehuli massacre case: Forty years on, three gets death for killing 24 Dalits in UP village
content: A gang of 17 dacoits dressed in khakis stormed Dehuli at around 4.30 pm on November 18, 1981. They targeted a Dalit family, gunning down 24 people, including the toddlers aged six months and two years, respectively.

title: DMK Ministers take joy in belittling north Indians: BJP leader Annamalai
content: He shared a video of Tamil Nadu Minister for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises T.M. Anbarasan saying, “Those who studied Hindi are rearing cattle, selling pani puri and involved in construction and carpentry works.”

title: Privileges Committee to hear complaints against IAS officer, police officer of Karnataka
content: Raju Kage complained about IAS officer Rajender Kumar Kataria and Basavaraj Mattimud about Additional Superintendent of Police Mahesh Meghannavar

title: An online portal to pay tributes to departed loved ones
content: The dedicated platform www.AllSouls.rip enables people to post their heartfelt tributes and memorials.

title: West Bengal informs Supreme Court of fresh exercise to identify Backward Classes
content: The State had appealed the Supreme Court against a Calcutta High Court judgment striking down its policy to include several castes, largely Muslim communities, in the OBC List

title: Ramanagara district administration initiates process to recover 14 acres of land encroached by Union Minister H.D. Kumaraswamy near Bengaluru
content: Heavy machinery, including JCBs and tractors, carrying survey stones to mark the recovered land has been moved into the farm land amidst tight security

title: 17,000 kms in the air: The unseen strain of IPL cricketer's travel grind
content: Champions Trophy was marked by logistical challenges and controversy for other teams as India played all matches in Dubai. The IPL 2025 will see players undergoing extensive travel, with Royal Challengers Bangalore covering the longest distance among all teams. That is one of the unseen aspects that cricketers face during such T20 leagues.

title: Why SpaceX's Dragon takes 17 hours while Russia's Soyuz returns in just 3.5 hours
content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams are returning to Earth aboard SpaceX's Crew Dragon after a nine-month stay at the International Space Station. The return, initially planned for June 2024, was delayed due to technical issues with Boeing’s Starliner. The Dragon capsule will splash down off Florida's coast, safely bringing the astronauts back.

title: Watch: Capsule carrying stranded Nasa astronauts departs from ISS
content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams are returning to Earth after an unexpected nine-month stay on the ISS. Their mission extended due to technical issues with Boeing's Starliner capsule, and they switched to SpaceX for their return. A relief crew's arrival enabled their departure.

title: 'Never a personal criticism ...': Hafeez clarifies remarks on Pak's past stars
content: Mohammad Hafeez has clarified his recent comments on Pakistan's past cricket stars, stating that they were taken out of context. He aimed to discuss the impact of winning ICC events to inspire future generations, rather than criticise legendary players. The controversy followed Pakistan's poor performance in the recent Champions Trophy.

title: Putin, Trump two-hour call scheduled for today amid Ukraine ceasefire talks: Kremlin
content: Presidents Putin and Trump are set to discuss a US-proposed Ukraine ceasefire. Considerable progress has been made toward a settlement, with Trump indicating that an agreement could be announced shortly. However, Russia seeks additional concessions from Ukraine, and the G7 warns of expanded sanctions if necessary.

title: 'Did not pay condolences': Rahul targets PM Modi on Maha Kumbh speech in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized PM Modi for not expressing condolences for the Maha Kumbh stampede victims during his Lok Sabha address. He also highlighted employment issues. PM Modi had praised the success of the Maha Kumbh 2025, attributing its success to the people of India, Uttar Pradesh, and Prayagraj, and countered critics who doubted India's capabilities.

title: Ban on mosque loudspeakers triggers return of an almost forgotten practice in Sambhal
content: In Sambhal, the removal of loudspeakers from mosques led to the revival of an old practice where men walk the streets, calling for sehri. Mohd Shoaib now takes on the role, ensuring no one misses the pre-dawn meal. Enforcing noise regulations, officials stress individual voices remain unrestricted, sparking discussions on religious expression and state intervention.

title: ‘Jinxed’ bungalow or political trap? Uttarakhand minister’s resignation fuels myth
content: Uttarakhand's R2 bungalow in Yamuna Colony is rumored to be 'unlucky'. Finance minister Premchand Aggarwal's recent resignation adds to this belief. Since the N D Tiwari-led Congress govt, several occupants, including Shoorveer Singh Sajwan and Harak Singh Rawat, faced abrupt political ends. The bungalow's reputation as politically jinxed continues with Aggarwal's departure.

title: 'Nectar of unity is key outcome of Maha Kumbh': Top quotes from PM Modi's LS address
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised Prayagraj's Maha Kumbh 2025 as a significant milestone for India during his address to the Lok Sabha. He credited the people of India, UP, and Prayagraj for their contributions and thanked them for the event's grand success, highlighting the global recognition it brought to India.

title: Massive security breach at Vaishno Devi after woman held for carrying pistol
content: A Delhi woman was arrested at the Mata Vaishno Devi shrine in Jammu and Kashmir after a loaded pistol with six rounds was found in her possession. The firearm's licence had expired years ago. Meanwhile, another pilgrim from Uttar Pradesh was booked after two cartridges were discovered in his bag.

title: Noel, Jejeebhoy sisters join board of Ratan Tata Endowment Trust
content: Noel Tata, alongside Shireen and Deanna Jejeebhoy, has joined the Ratan Tata Endowment Trust board. The Trust has also welcomed two Tata group executives, RR Shastri and Jamsheed Poncha, as new appointees.

title: Delhi government to ink MoU with Centre on April 10 to implement Ayushman Bharat in capital
content: Implementation of the scheme was one of the major promises of the BJP for the Delhi Assembly elections held in February

title: Members terms KPSC a ‘den of corruption’, suggest major surgery for removal of malpractices in KAS exam in Karnataka
content: They demanded a comprehensive set of reforms to ensure transparency in the conduct of examinations and in the recruitment of civil servants

title: 51 acres of Telangana’s last cane forest in Mulugu reduced to 5 acres
content: Land prices surged, particularly after the Ramappa (Rudreshwara) temple declared as the world heritage site by the UNESCO in 2021

title: Gram Swaraj and Panchayat Raj Bill aims to bring all assets under purview of rural local authorities in Karnataka
content: It proposes extending provisions of property tax to the premises and buildings in unauthorised settlements, other than government land and to unauthorised buildings in official settlements, as provided in the 1993 Act

title: Maha Kumbh strengthened India’s spirit of unity, says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi praises the unity and strength displayed at the Maha Kumbh in a Lok Sabha statement.

title: Gang of property offenders busted, five arrested in Chittoor district of A.P.
content: The accused were involved in chain snatchings, theft of two-wheelers and also in burglaries in temples and houses in various police stations across the State

title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman says committed to bring normalcy in Manipur
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman assures support for Manipur’s economic growth, emphasising commitment to restoring normalcy and peace in the State

title: Lok Sabha adjourned for the day amid opposition protests over PM Modi’s Mahakumbh remarks
content: House proceedings were adjourned till 1 p.m. soon after PM Modi made a statement on the Mahakumbh and opposition members rose in their seats in protest

title: Leader of Opposition should be allowed to speak in House but not given permission in ‘new India’, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi criticizes PM Modi for not paying homage to Mahakumbh stampede victims, demands focus on employment in Lok Sabha.

title: Bill tabled to provide 4% quota for Muslims in public contracts in Karnataka
content: The principal opposition BJP termed the government’s move to provide 4% reservation for Muslims in government contracts an ‘unconstitutional misadventure’ and ‘appeasement politics’

title: Railway accidents have come down by 90% since Lalu Prasad’s time: Vaishnaw
content: Ashwini Vaishnaw said PM Modi focussed on safety and brought in new technology and investment reducing railway accidents by 90% from the earlier period and 80% less than what it was in 2014-15

title: Stamp Bill tabled to formalise digital e-stamping and payment of stamp duty by electronic means in Karnataka
content: The Registration (Karnataka Amendment) Bill, 2025 was introduced to amend the Registration Act of 1908 to compulsorily register power-of-attorney authorising transfer of immovable property with or without consideration

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan assures timely completion of Kannur airport land acquisition
content: CM says in first phase, 1,113.33 acres of land has been acquired and handed over to Kannur International Airport Limited, while acquisition of 804.37 acres in second phase is under way

title: ‘BJP wants to make Maharashtra next Manipur’: Aaditya Thackeray attacks state govt over Nagpur violence
content: The Shiv Sena UBT leader raised questions regarding the Maharashtra government’s handling of recent violence in Nagpur, highlighting the Chief Minister’s Office (CMO) ‘s lack of response

title: Even if you are thousands of miles away, you remain in our hearts: PM Modi writes to Sunita Williams
content: Prime Minister Modi invites NASA astronaut Sunita Williams to visit India after her return from the International Space Station.

title: Parents can cancel gift or settlement deeds if children fail to take care of them, even in the absence of an explicit condition: Madras HC
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar hold that it is enough if the intent regarding maintenance is found to be implicit

title: Parliament clears ₹51,463 crore extra spending for FY25, Manipur Budget for FY26
content: Parliament also approved the ₹1,291 crore demands for excess grants for 2021-22 fiscal and the ₹1,861 crore supplementary demands for grants for Manipur in 2024-25.

title: Retired police sub-inspector murdered by gang in Tirunelveli
content: The deceased, who was one of the administrators of Murtim Zarkhan Dargha, was waging legal battle in the court pertaining to a 36-cent land parcel under dispute

title: EC tells SC it is willing to hear petitioners on uploading voter turnout data
content: The PILs sought a direction to the poll panel to upload polling station-wise voter turnout data on its website within 48 hours of conclusion of polling in the Lok Sabha and Assembly elections.

title: Woman pilgrim from Delhi held with loaded pistol at Vaishno Devi shrine
content: The licence for the gun found in the possession of Jyoti Gupta was found to have expired a couple of years ago, the officials said

title: INTACH to offer ‘Pada Seva’ to devotees trekking to Srisailam
content: The volunteers of Indian National Trust for Art and Cultural Heritage’s Nandyal unit would be offering foot massage to thousands of devotees from Karnataka and Maharashtra who would be trekking long distances to reach the famous Shaivaite shrine of Srisailam for the Ugadi celebrations

title: Supreme Court to consider if Lokpal has jurisdiction over judges
content: Can someone go to a police station and file and FIR against a judge, senior advocate Kapil Sibal asks

title: Nagpur violence seems premeditated; mob targeted specific houses, says Maharashtra CM Fadnavis
content: Mr. Fadnavis attributed the “heightened emotions” to the release of the movie Chhava, which depicted the brutal atrocities committed by Aurangzeb against Sambhaji Maharaj.

title: Can't avail separate UPSC exam attempts as 'able' and 'disabled' candidate: SC to Puja Khedkar
content: The top court also extended the protection from arrest granted to Ms. Khedkar on January 15 till April 15.

title: Devotee collapses while in queue at Rameswaram temple, dies
content: Earlier on March 16, a 50-year-old devotee from Karaikudi collapsed and died while standing in queue to obtain darshan ticket at Subramaniaswamy temple in Tiruchendur

title: Kerala Assembly: UDF stages walkout over Idukki encroachments
content: Opposition protests against Speaker’s decision to deny it permission for adjournment motion to debate recent revelations of large-scale encroachments in Chokramudi hills and other areas in Idukki

title: Sonia Gandhi demands ₹400 minimum wage, 150 workdays under MGNREGA
content: The budget allocation (for the scheme) remains stagnant at ₹86,000 crore, a 10-year low as a percentage of GDP, Sonia Gandhi alleged.

title: Delimitation issue: DMK walks out of Lok Sabha saying discussion denied
content: “The government has not responded to the concerns raised by Tamil Nadu. We are not being allowed to raise this issue. We want clarity from the government on this issue,” DMK leader Kanimozhi says

title: Bodies of Hmar, Zo tribes in Manipur decide to lift shutdown in violence-hit Churachandpur
content: Hmar and Zomi communities in Manipur’s Churachandpur district agree to lift shutdown after clashes, aiming to restore peace

title: Novel initiative in Telangana’s Karimnagar to take learning beyond classrooms
content: The students donned the role of vegetable vendors, promoting cultivation of organic vegetables and highlighting the nutritional benefit of organic produce

title: Centre with farmers without any discrimination: Agriculture Minister Chouhan
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra had sought an update on the implementation of the Vidarbha package, under which Kerala's Wayanad, Palakkad and Kasargod districts were also included, for farmers

title: 163 paneer samples tested by FSSAI in Karnataka
content: On March 3, following media reports and social media posts about adulteration, the Chief Minister’s office had asked the Commissioner of FSSAI to immediately examine the quality of paneer in Karnataka

title: Youths brawl over ‘camphor-laced’ MDMA in Kerala’s Malappuram
content: A group of youngsters engage in fisticuffs in front of local residents near Kottakkal claiming that they were ‘supplied poor-quality MDMA’

title: Tamil Nadu’s Government Railway Police strength remains unchanged since 1989
content: There is an urgent need to increase the manpower of GRP by 50% to give a sense of safety and security to railway passengers in Tamil Nadu

title: Attacker, victim put on par: Jaishankar on Kashmir
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar bats for a strong and fair United Nations at the Raisina Dialogue

title: BJP leaders Annamalai, Tamilisai booked for attempting to protest without permission
content: Police sources said Mr. Annamalai and 1,000 others were booked for unlawful assembly and staging protests without permission.

title: ED conducts searches against George Soros' OSF, linked entities
content: The case pertains to alleged foreign direct investment being sourced by OSF and the utilisation of these funds by certain beneficiaries in alleged contravention of FEMA guidelines

title: J&K’s governance dilemma amid political uncertainty and parallel power structures
content: Unlike any other State or administrative unit, J&K, with its history of turbulence, presents a complex challenge

title: Kannada Sahitya Parishat President Mahesh Joshi moves High Court of Karnataka seeking protection
content: The court asked the government advocate to get instructions from the authorities on the representation given by Mahesh Joshi in January seeking police protection

title: Om Birla calls for developing Delhi Vidhan Sabha as 'model' Assembly
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Birla said people have high expectations from the legislators and the new government in the capital

title: Trump's 'America First' policy is not America alone: Tulsi Gabbard
content: Ms. Gabbard said just like U.S. President Trump's 'America First' policy, PM Modi is committed to the 'India First' approach.

title: Rahul Gandhi meets visiting New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon
content: The meeting came a day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Mr. Luxon held talks and India and New Zealand inked an ambitious pact to institutionalise defence ties besides vowing to boost cooperation in the Indo-Pacific

title: Westbrook 'a wolf,' fuels Nuggets' improbable win
content: Russell Westbrook set the tone for an undermanned Nuggets team Monday night at Golden State, prompting teammate Aaron Gordon to remark, "First off, Russ is not just a dog. He's a wolf."

title: Kerr says Curry 'exhausted,' could sit vs. Bucks
content: After watching Stephen Curry struggle against an undermanned Nuggets team Monday night, coach Steve Kerr said the Warriors superstar is "exhausted" and in need of a rest day.

title: Ohtani, Yamamoto lead Dodgers to Tokyo win
content: Shohei Ohtani and Yoshinobu Yamamoto led the Dodgers to a season-opening victory in their home country of Japan.

title: Rose win Unrivaled's first women's 3-on-3 title
content: Rose beat Vinyl in the Unrivaled championship game, capping the inaugural season of the women's 3-on-3 basketball league.

title: WVU snub 'robbery' at highest level, gov. says
content: West Virginia Gov. Patrick Morrisey wants his attorney general to investigate and work closely with the NCAA to ensure the men's tournament selection process is transparent and fair.

title: Brink 'icked out' by replies to Sparks' male tryouts
content: Sparks forward Cameron Brink said she was unsettled by the response she saw online to a call by the team for men to try out for the practice squad.

title: Deion wants foe for CU spring game; Cuse willing
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders wants to save spring football games by having teams practice against another team for a week before playing them in a scrimmage.

title: Belichick flips 4-star Ruffin from A&M to UNC
content: Four-star defensive tackle Trashawn Ruffin, No. 238 in the ESPN Junior 300, flipped his commitment from Texas A&M to North Carolina on Monday, marking the Tar Heels' highest-rated new pledge since coach Bill Belichick took over the program.

title: Giant Killers: Predicting 10 women's March Madness early-round upsets
content: Looking for upsets in the women's March Madness bracket? Harvard, Vanderbilt and South Dakota State are looking to hang around.

title: 'I didn't know Kyle Tucker spoke': Why the 'silent assassin' could be MLB's next $400 million star
content: He might not be a household name, but the new Cubs outfielder is still the same slugger he was back when he was breaking records in high school.

title: MLB's villains or its gold standard? How the Dodgers got here
content: Love them or loathe them, the defending champs built a new evil empire with a series of monumental moves.

title: 'It's Pop's decision. He's earned that': Inside Gregg Popovich's fight to return to the sideline
content: For the first time in 30 years, the legendary coach has been on a different sideline, battling to return to what he once was. This is the story of his season -- and what might come next for the proud franchise he leads.

title: NFL experts debate free agency: What were the biggest head-scratcher signings?
content: We asked 10 experts to weigh in on the best (Davante Adams?) and worst moves (Javon Kinlaw?) from NFL free agency.

title: 'I feel like I'm a more complete player': Players win a sign of what's to come for Rory in 2025?
content: After two early wins in signature events, McIlroy's game is in a great place with the Masters and the rest of the majors in the not-too-distant future.

title: "Someone Who Lived 300 Years Ago...": Uddhav Thackeray On Aurangzeb Row
content: Amid violence in Maharashtra's Nagpur - over demands Mughal ruler Aurangzeb's grave be moved out of the state - ex-Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray questioned the need for a face-off, pointing out the Mughal emperor had died over 300 years ago.

title: "Thousands Crying": Supreme Court Talks Of CBI Probe Into Homeowners' Troubles
content: The Supreme Court has expressed concern about the alleged nexus between banks and builders and assured that a probe by the Central Bureau of Investigation will be held into the grievances of homeowners.

title: "Police Came After They Ran Away": Nagpur Residents Recall Mob Horror
content: Houses were vandalised and vehicles were torched, recounted the residents of Nagpur, narrating how the violence unfolded last night after calls by a right-wing outfit to remove the tomb of Mughal ruler Aurangzeb.

title: Ahead Of Putin Talks, Trump Says Many Elements In Ukraine Deal Agreed To
content: US President Donald Trump has "strongly" requested President Putin to spare the lives of Ukrainian troops.

title: S Jaishankar Highlights UN's Blunder On Kashmir, Calls For New World Order
content: The injustice done by the West at the UN over Kashmir was highlighted at The Raisina Dialogue - a global multilateral conference held in New Delhi each year.

title: Over 400 Killed In Israel's Biggest Strike On Gaza Since Ceasefire
content: At least 413 people were killed in Gaza on Tuesday as the Israeli military conducted "extensive strikes" on Hamas targetsamid stalled truce talks, the biggest attack in the war-torn territory since the ceasefirebegan on January 19.

title: Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore Head Back To Earth After 9 Months On ISS
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are now closer home. They departed this morning from the International Space Station on the Dragon spacecraft after being "stranded" for nine months on the orbital hub.

title: Live Updates: Sunita Williams Heads Back To Earth After Nine Months
content: Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, two astronauts stuck at the International Space Station for more than nine months, began their return journey to Earth on Tuesday.

title: Man Whipped With Belts, Pipes In UP, Accused Post Video On Instagram
content: Four men with belts and rubber pipes in their hands surrounded a man in a room, they cornered him and whipped him several times.

title: Aurangzeb's Unremarkable Tomb Sparks A Massive Storm
content: Nagpur's Mahal area witnessed violence and arson last night. Cars were set on fire, stones were thrown and four civilians and over 10 cops were injured

title: Pak Star Loses Cool After NZ Defeat: "People Are Waiting To See Us Lose..."
content: Pakistan cricket team fast bowler Haris Rauf lost his cool during the post-match press conference following his team's defeat against New Zealand in the second T20I encounter.

title: Video: Fire Breaks Out Near Oil Depot In Jharkhand, Village Evacuated
content: A massive fire broke out near an Indian Oil Terminal in Jharkhand's Devghar today. People from the nearby village have been evacuated and a goods and passenger train at the Jasidh station - located close to the spot - have been moved away.

title: Missing Sudiksha Konanki's Parents Ask Cops To Declare Her Dead: Reports
content: Sudiksha Konanki, a citizen of India and a permanent resident of the United States, was last seen on March 6 at the Riu Republic Resort in Punta Cana town.

title: What Sunita Williams Will Experience During Spacecraft Reentry To Earth
content: From the astronaut's perspective, the view from a window during reentry is nothing but a wall of fire.

title: NHL insiders debate playoff bubble teams, Stanley Cup finalists, MVP picks
content: Which team on the fringe is getting in? And which is under the most pressure in the final month? Who wins the Hart Trophy?

title: NHL playoff watch: Will the Oilers win the Pacific Division crown?
content: The race against the Golden Knights for the No. 1 seed is not over yet. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: You've signed a one-of-a-kind freshman in Cooper Flagg. Now what? Here's how Duke built a contender around its prized recruit
content: In an era when teams are incentivized to build around experience, the Blue Devils built a contender with youth.

title: Crowning a champion in our 64-team college football bracket
content: From the Sweet 16 to the Final Four, we determine who is left standing at the end of our football version of March Madness.

title: When can Liverpool win the Premier League title?
content: Liverpool have built up a 12-point lead at the top of the Premier League table and seem destined to be crowned English champions for a 20th time. But how early could the championship be sealed?

title: Unretired and unbeaten: Wojciech Szczesny's fairy-tale return to football
content: Szczesny retired just over 200 days ago. Now, he's back with Barcelona and undefeated in 17 appearances.

title: Sargent looks to carry 'flow state' over to USMNT
content: U.S. striker Josh Sargent described his current run of form with club side Norwich City as a "flow state where everything is just happening for you," but admitted his lack of production at international level is on his mind.

title: Messi out for Argentina after MRI reveals injury
content: Lionel Messi will not join Argentina for World Cup qualifiers against Brazil and Uruguay, failing to make the final roster after featuring in the pre-list.

title: Jamie Carragher's son receives Malta call-up
content: The son of former Liverpool and England defender Jamie Carragher has been called up for international duty by Malta.

title: Rabiot lashes out at PSG prez: 'Can't buy class'
content: Marseille midfielder Adrien Rabiot took aim at Paris Saint-Germain president Nasser Al-Khelaifi following his side's 3-1 loss to the Ligue 1 leaders on Sunday, writing on social media that "you can't buy class."

title: Man Utd season ticket prices to rise by around 5%
content: Manchester United have announced ticket price rises ahead of next season less than a week after unveiling plans to build a new £2 billion stadium.

title: Antonio vows to return to football after car crash
content: West Ham United forward Michail Antonio has insisted he will play professional football again after he recovers from being involved in a near-fatal road traffic collision in December.

title: Chelsea condemn racist abuse towards Fofana
content: Chelsea have strongly condemned the racist abuse faced by defender Wesley Fofana in the aftermath of their loss to Arsenal on Sunday.

title: Club mistakenly mourns player who isn't dead
content: The management of Bulgarian top-flight side Arda Kardzhali apologised after their former player Petko Ganchev, whose death they mourned in a minute's silence before Sunday's match with Levski Sofia, turned out to be alive.

title: What would it take for Wrexham to reach Premier League from League 1?

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Flyweight has a new No. 1
